intro: Borbonia sericea, commonly known as silky borbonia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and covered with a fine, silky hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. Borbonia sericea is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar.
